intro: [WRONG START] Polygonatum luteoverrucososum, commonly known as the yellow rough Solomon's seal, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
